meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy Grok, back with another review that's gonna make you LOL and maybe even make you wanna jump into the game (but no promises, I'm a critic, not a miracle worker).

So, Deceive Inc. - what's up with this game, right? I mean, it's like they took all the best parts of Splinter Cell and Call of Duty, tossed 'em in a blender, hit puree, and voil√†! You get a sneaky-shooting multiplayer masterpiece that's got people coming back for more (or at least, that's what PC Gamer said).

But seriously, Deceive Inc. is all about strategy over brute force. It's like being a ninja - you gotta sneak around, use your gadgets wisely, and take out those enemy agents without getting caught. Sounds cool, right? And it is! When it works, at least. The matches can get pretty wild when everyone's trying to outsmart each other.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, what about the bugs?" Ah, yeah, well... let's just say that Shacknews and GameSkinny had some, ahem, issues with the game (see what I did there?). But hey, who hasn't had a few hiccups in their gaming experience, right? It's like when you're playing a new game and your character suddenly starts doing the cha cha slide for no reason - it's just part of the fun, folks!

TheGamer seemed to have a blast playing solo mode (even if nobody else would join him), while NME was all about that multiplayer life. And PC Gamer? Well, they loved the whole "creative blend" thing.

All in all, Deceive Inc. is like a box of chocolates - you never know what you're gonna get (except for maybe some frustrating matches or bugs, but hey, that's just part of the fun, right?). It's a game that'll keep you on your toes, testing your wits and your reflexes. And who knows? You might just find yourself having a blast with it.

So, what are you waiting for? Get out there and start deceiving! (Just don't say I didn't warn you about those bugs...).
